content: Lamentation for Egypt
The word of the  came to me:
Mortal, prophesy, and say, Thus says the Lord :
Wail, “Alas for the day!”
it will be a day of clouds,
A sword shall come upon Egypt,
when the slain fall in Egypt,
Ethiopia, and Put, and Lud, and all Arabia, and Libya, and the people of the allied land shall fall with them by the sword.
On that day, messengers shall go out from me in ships to terrify the unsuspecting Ethiopians; and anguish shall come upon them on the day of Egypt’s doom; for it is coming!
Thus says the Lord :
I will put an end to the hordes of Egypt,
He and his people with him, the most terrible of the nations,
and they shall draw their swords against Egypt,
I will dry up the channels,
I will bring desolation upon the land and everything in it
I the  have spoken.
Thus says the Lord :
I will destroy the idols
there shall no longer be a prince in the land of Egypt;
I will make Pathros a desolation,
I will pour my wrath upon Pelusium,
I will set fire to Egypt;
Thebes shall be breached,
The young men of On and of Pi-beseth shall fall by the sword;
At Tehaphnehes the day shall be dark,
and its proud might shall come to an end;
Thus I will execute acts of judgment on Egypt.
Proclamation against Pharaoh
In the eleventh year, in the first month, on the seventh day of the month, the word of the  came to me:
Mortal, I have broken the arm of Pharaoh king of Egypt; it has not been bound up for healing or wrapped with a bandage, so that it may become strong to wield the sword.
Therefore thus says the Lord : I am against Pharaoh king of Egypt, and will break his arms, both the strong arm and the one that was broken; and I will make the sword fall from his hand.
I will scatter the Egyptians among the nations, and disperse them throughout the lands.
I will strengthen the arms of the king of Babylon, and put my sword in his hand; but I will break the arms of Pharaoh, and he will groan before him with the groans of one mortally wounded.

I will strengthen the arms of the king of Babylon, but the arms of Pharaoh shall fall. And they shall know that I am the , when I put my sword into the hand of the king of Babylon. He shall stretch it out against the land of Egypt,
and I will scatter the Egyptians among the nations and disperse them throughout the countries. Then they shall know that I am the .
